info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:28PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Berkshire and southeastern Columbia Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 328 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Copake, or 12 miles west of Great Barrington, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roadways. Locations impacted include... Great Barrington, Copake, Sheffield, Ancram, Housatonic, Ashley Falls, Stockbridge, Hillsdale, Taghkanic, Alford, Ancramdale, Gomorrah, Weed Mines, Churchtown, Craryville, Newsboy Statue, Glendale, Linlithgo Mills, North Hillsdale and Williamsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
